meanings.definition: Relating to or situated on the side of the body or an organ that is farther from the middle or center.
meanings.sent1: The costally located ribs provide protection for the vital organs.
meanings.sent2: She pointed to the costally positioned scar on her side.
meanings.sent3: The costally placed sticker on his car made it look unique.
meanings.sent4: The costally arranged books on the shelf created a visually appealing pattern.
meanings.sent5: The costally situated lighthouse guided ships safely through the night.

meanings.sent1: The boat sailed costally along the shore, enjoying the scenic view.
meanings.sent2: He ran costally towards the ocean, feeling the cool breeze on his face.
meanings.sent3: The birds flew costally, following the coastline in search of food.
meanings.sent4: The clouds moved costally across the sky, casting shadows on the beach.
meanings.sent5: The waves crashed costally against the rocks, creating a soothing sound.
